channel.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
channel.description:
Hey, ok so I portforwarded a year ago succesfully, and now it doesn't work... (I accidentally deleted it...) I have used Portforward.com and followed the tutorial, I go to canyouseeme.org to see if it can see me, it says yes, but when someone tries to login it says 'Error connecting to server', is there something I did wrong? My router asks for a Service name, and Server IP, what do I put for the server ip? My IPv4 or the IP I see on whatsmyip.org or what? It's really frustrating for me.. I don't know what to do :( (something I posted on another forum)
Hey guys, I'm using the Exion client (PI), and I've changed the ip to my no-ip, but it still only lets me log in, none of my friends. Could it be a problem with my port? (canyouseeme.org said it was open) My server? (runelocus.com said it was online) Or is there something wrong with my webclient? Maybe the IP was supposed to be changed in another folder other then client.java.. (doubt it...) I just don't know whats going on.. I got a new desktop a couple weeks ago, could this have effected anything? (I host on my laptop, and always have) I would really appreciate it if someone could add me on MSN (keatrm103@gmail.com) so we can have a real conversation, or PM/post here any instructions you could give. Really appreciate it, Keat

item.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Keatrm, post:7, topic:392842”]when I add the IP to the ‘Server IP’ i get this
Server IP address must be a LAN IP address.[/quote]Go to the status page on your router the LAN Ip will be listed there.

Read full topic

Ok well pm me and we’ll do team viewer.

item.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

Ok you need to go to no-ip.org and download it, then get a host. Once you do all that, open it and check it off. Once done, there will be an icon on the bottom that looks like this http://www.google.com/imgres?imgurl=http://img.informer.com/icons/png/48/649/649492.png&imgrefurl=http://vitalwerks-no-ip-com.software.informer.com/&usg=__2gIBs6r71sJbajqoW2XDp89pnfU=&h=48&w=48&sz=3&hl=en&start=21&zoom=1&tbnid=tTrnGIlbgVtbIM:&tbnh=48&tbnw=48&ei=rKW4TcCWCYGssAOnqdT9Bw&prev=/search%3Fq%3Dno-ip%26hl%3Den%26biw%3D1362%26bih%3D559%26gbv%3D2%26tbm%3Disch&itbs=1&iact=rc&dur=1123&page=2&ndsp=22&ved=1t:429,r:5,s:21&tx=40&ty=28 right click, copy ip address, and paste it to the IP’s you need to edit.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
item.dc:creator: @Keatrm Keatrm
item.description:
@Keatrm wrote:

Yeah…
Ok so I’m using Netgear WNR2000 v2 Router, when you add a port forward it has this you have to fill out:

Service Name: (i put my no-ip here cuz i can) Service Type: TCP/UPD or TCP or UPD (I choose TCP/UPD) Start Port: 43594 End Port: 43594 Serve IP Address:(this is what seems to get me..): I put "192.168.3" which is my computers IPv4 address. I think the last part is wrong.. but when I try to put my ip I get from whatsismyip.com it says you cannot use LAN addresses.
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE SOMEONE HELP ME!

Read full topic

item.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
item.dc:creator: @jmcm71 jmcm71
item.description:
@jmcm71 wrote:

im srry u need some big help pfing

Read full topic

item.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
item.dc:creator: @Keatrm Keatrm
item.description:
@Keatrm wrote:

It asks for server IP address, then it has xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx so I can’t put the no-ip.com ip, when I put my IP to the computer it says it cannot be LAN… it’s all a big mess

Read full topic

item.title: Server Issues [PI](portforwarding too)
item.dc:creator: @jmcm71 jmcm71
item.description:
@jmcm71 wrote:

I dont know how but i know you should probally goto no-ip.org and change your ip to that ip then download no-ip for your computer type and then type your internet ip in the browser search bar goto portfowarding and change that stuff to your no-ip thats all i know it worked for me so i wish you good luck!

Read full topic

I have used Portforward.com and followed the tutorial, I go to canyouseeme.org to see if it can see me, it says yes, but when someone tries to login it says ‘Error connecting to server’, is there something I did wrong?
